results.content:
Overall the course is theoretically sharp! The first portion of the course is theoretical and as the course progresses,  various applications are provided to put these theoretical concepts of SSL/TLS to work with HTTPS, as with Cerbot, Wordpress, Cloudflare and NGINX. 

It was nice to see web host domain features, to include free offers, put to use proactively as cyber-security, as an additional layer of protection. Also, the instructor, Bogdan Stashchuk, exposes common risks associated with creating and or using sensitive and unique data on a HTTP domain prior to getting to a HTTPS domain, with SSL and/or TLS. 

With one of the web domain host mentioned like, Cloudflare, there lists common threats for domains and DNS, how the attack occurs and it's prevention. Although there are many web domain hosts, at least, the instructor provides a sample set for learning purposes, staying outside of a single focus, for a broader perspective of applying SSL/TLS for HTTPS.

I would say that this course increased my confidence in being able to work with cyber features.
Thanks Bogdan...

Pros:
- Good structure and pacing, easy to come back to a lecture that needs revisiting
- Knowledgeable instructor with obvious experience in the field
- Extensive examples for explained concepts
Cons:
- Lectures in this course (while being great as-is) could be improved even more by putting useful links and sources in the Resources tab in Udemy web interface
- No quizzes or custom assignments. That would encourage students to apply their problem solving skills and knowledge received from this course.
- Numerous mispronunciations of key concepts, which distracts from otherwise very informative learning experience and may lead to propagation of mistakes in learners' future communication
